questions.question: What is the primary goal of clustering in unstructured data analysis?

options.A: To assign each document to a single predefined category
options.B: To group similar documents or data points into clusters without predefined labels
options.C: To translate documents into multiple languages
options.D: To count the number of words in each document

questions.question: **(Medium) ** Which of the following are common types of clustering algorithms?
What is a key challenge when clustering high-dimensional textual data?

options.A: The curse of dimensionality leading to sparse data and difficulty in measuring similarity

questions.question: **(Hard) ** Which of the following are challenges associated with clustering algorithms?
How does hierarchical clustering differ from centroid-based clustering?

options.A: Hierarchical clustering builds a tree of clusters by merging or splitting, centroid-based assumes spherical clusters
options.B: Hierarchical clustering requires labeled data, centroid-based does not
options.C: Centroid-based clustering is only for images
options.D: Hierarchical clustering is faster than centroid-based

sections.title: Section 2: Clustering Model Evaluation and Practical Use

questions.question: Which distance measure is commonly used in centroid-based clustering?
Why is it difficult to evaluate the quality of clustering results?

options.A: Because clusters may not have clear boundaries and evaluation metrics vary by algorithm
options.B: Because clustering always produces perfect results
options.D: Because all clusters have the same size

questions.question: **(Hard) ** What are some strategies to improve clustering interpretability?

options.B: Limiting the number of clusters to a manageable number
options.C: Using domain knowledge to label clusters
options.D: Don't scale the data to preserve data integrity

questions.question: What is the effect of the curse of dimensionality on clustering?

options.A: It makes all points appear equally distant, reducing meaningful similarity
options.B: It increases the number of clusters

questions.question: Why might clustering be used in conjunction with topic modeling?

options.A: To provide labels for topic modeling for better results
options.C: To label documents with sentiment scores
options.D: To further group documents based on topic distributions
